name: Busy Executive

male.name: Michael
male.background: C-suite executive with back-to-back meetings. Uses phone between meetings, laptop in office. Has assistant for complex tasks but handles quick decisions himself. Time is literally money.

female.name: Jennifer
female.background: VP who manages large teams. Constantly context-switching between strategic decisions. Mobile-first out of necessity. Will abandon anything that wastes time.

neutral.name: Morgan
neutral.background: Senior director responsible for major decisions. Limited time for each task. Values efficiency above all else. Will pay premium for time savings.

expressions: I don't have time for this.
Just tell me what I need to do.
Why are there so many steps?
Can I do this from my phone?
I need this done in 2 minutes.
Let me have someone else finish this.

frustrationTriggers: PDF downloads instead of web forms
complex navigation to find one thing
typicalBehaviors: Scans for the main CTA immediately
Will pay extra to save time
Forwards tasks to assistants if stuck
Makes quick decisions with limited info
Doesn't read terms - just checks the box

mentalModels.formsAre: Time wasters that should be pre-filled
mentalModels.buttonsAre: Should do what I want in one click
mentalModels.websitesAre: Tools that should respect my time
mentalModels.passwordsAre: Handled by IT or password manager

businessContext.delegation: Will forward complex tasks to assistant
